runs.comm: good length and swinging away outside off, Guptill lets it pass
Abbott shortens his length around off, dropped in front of the covers
another away-going delivery outside off, which is left alone calmly
dug in short and wide outside off, Guptill is on his tippy toes as he slashes it up and over second slip, beating a diving third man to his left
on a length and largely holds its line outside off, dabbed backward of point for one
137ks, bumpy short ball, rises outside off. Williamson has a jittery waft at it and is beaten
gentle fullish ball on a fourth-stump line, driven straight to mid-off with a bent knee
length, angled in and straightens past the outside edge with some good extra lift
back of a length and cuts back in off the seam to slice Guptill into half. Zips over the stumps after beating the inside  edge
shortish and on the hips, nudged in front of square on the leg side after hopping up
back of a length, top-of-off line, punched towards mid-on, where Morne fumbles and allows too
swerving onto the pads, Williamson can't glance it away. Off the pad and wanders behind to Van Wyk
fractionally short and outside off, Guptill crunches it and finds backward point (Rossouw)
width on offer outside off, Guptill manufactures room, clears his front leg out of the way and scythes it over backward point, beats third man
a tad overpitched and outside off, Guptill drills a drive and finds mid-off
back of a length, Guptill leaps off his feet as he turns it to the right of mid-on
low full toss on off, bunted gently between the bowler and non-striker, beats mid-on to his left. AB runs across from mid-off and has it covered
dropped short and outside off, Williamson loads up for a hook and top-edges it over the cordon to third man, one-bounce four..
good length and on off, Guptill invests in a tap-and-run single in front of mid-off. Williamson reciprocated well
pitched up and on off, Williamson transfers his weight forward and eases it to the right of mid-off. Sweet timing
veering onto the pads, flicked through midwicket
short and tucks up Guptill for room, milked in front of mid-on for one
Morne errs too full and straight, Williamson twirls his wrists and picks it over midwicket with a flick

Impressive effort from AB. Good length and on middle, Williamson steps away outside leg and punts it or rather mis-hits it over the covers. AB runs back from mid-off, dives but can't quite pull off that stunning take
Good length and on middle and leg, Williamson flits away outside leg and lofts it. Better connection as he sends it away to the cow-corner boundary
back of a length and on middle and leg, patted towards midwicket
near yorker-length ball on middle, Williamson makes room and jabs it to the covers
sliding onto the pads, fine leg is up in the circle and Williamson dispatches it with a pretty flick over backward square leg
Rabada retorts with a 144.9ks lifter on off, Williamson seeks to turn to the leg side. Nearly spooned it back to the bowler off a leading edge
too full and straight now, Williamson brings his dexterous wrists into play again, clipping it between midwicket and mid-on. Third four of the over; New Zealand are off to a racy start..
shortish and outside off, dabbed in front of backward point
back of a length and outside off, Guptill loads up for a mighty swing and ends up french-cutting it to short fine leg via an inner edge
parcelled up and dispatched. Dragged short and outside off, no sting on it as Williamson ventures deep in the crease and slams a pull over midwicket
and again! Back of a length and comes in, picked up over backward square leg with the wrists
Williamson makes room outside leg, this is fired full and outside off. Squeezed to backward point, where Rossouw makes a sprawling save. Smart work..
back of a length and on off, dabbed in front of the covers for another of those urgent singles
poor ball and put away. Picked away off the pads, fine of short fine leg.
back of a length and outside off, chopped towards backward point
back of a length and on middle, semi-paddled and semi-pulled behind square
Williamson rides the bounce of this shortish ball outside off as he dinks it to third man
flicks this straight ball through midwicket and trots off to the other end
back of a length and outside off, slapped to backward point, where the fielder, Phangiso, I guess, winces
flatter and a hint of turn outside off with bounce, cut away past backward point
hurrying ball on middle, which is jabbed past the bowler to mid-off
drifts in on middle and leg, knocked through midwicket

communication breakdown.. Phangiso makes a mess of it, he fails to tip the bails off at the bowlers' end. Chopped in front of backward point. Williamson is halfway down the track in search for a single, Guptill isn't interested. Phangiso, perhaps, loses sight of the stumps and that's a clanger
patted through the covers for one

Phangison has his man now. Phangiso hangs it in the air, gets it to dip and turn after seeing Williamson dance down the track. He goes for a big swoosh and does not connect. Van Wyk does the rest. Phangiso strikes in his first over.. He does break the opening stand
back of a length, whipped over mid-on
good length and on middle, defended back to the bowler
banged in short and attacking the body, Worker top-edges a hook, it does not carry to long leg
short and wide outside off, Guptill kitchen-sinks it away in front of square on the off side. He simply powered it away to the boundary.
good length and on off, chipped in front of long-on
full as Worker sees the width. He likes it and slices it behind point to third man
fired on a leg-stump line, Worker can't pull it away as he is hit on the thigh
flatter and on off, Worker stands tall and punches it to deep mid-off
drifting down leg, helped to short fine leg, where Abbott dives to his left and stops the ball
fractionally short and on a leg-stump line as Worker wades into it. He pulls it powerfully over square leg. He sends the ball sailing into the stands
darted flat on middle and leg, mistimed slog sweep to deep midwicket
straight roller, Guptill stretches forward and drives it to long-off
Morkel drags it short and wide outside off, pulled with authority over midwicket. Long-on runs to his right in vaian
back of a length and outside off, punched towards deep cover
short and zips away outside off with loads of extra bounce. Worker seeks to run it down past slip to third man. No dice
back of a length and slanted across off, beaten again as he targets the third-man region
beats deep fine leg to his right. Shortish and slanted down leg, Workel swivels on the back foot and controls a pull
Worker ventures down the track, Morkel pulls his length back. The batsman goes for a big swing but has to settle with an inside edge onto the pad
Rabada shoves this down leg, wide
Guptill feigns away outside leg, Rabada follows him and bags it short. Guptill gets into a tangle and pops it just wide of backward point
shortish and angled away outside off, Worker shapes for a pull and drags it behind the square-leg umpire off the inside half of the bat
full and on middle and leg, clipped to deep midwicket
bouncer outside off, Worker sinks and yanks his head out of the way
another one, which flies through to Van Wyk. Lifter outside off, Worker hooks and only connects with thin air
down the track as Rabada pulls his length back. Worker, though, adjusts, and helps it fine on the leg side
length and outside off, flashed down to third man off an outside edge
looks like a slower ball outside off, which is slapped down to the covers. 115ks, slower it is..

and again, 113ks as Wiese sucks pace off this outside off. Worker manufactures his own pace and carves it away past the covers. Guptill belatedly slides his bat in, almost as if he was giving a pathway for the throw. He lazily slides his back in. Good throw from sweeper cover, Van Wyk was quick to take the bails off. They go to the TV umpire.. Looks like the bat is on the line by the time the bails were whipped off. OUT flashes on the giant screen and the crowd likes it. Silly error from Guptill, who shakes his head on his way back. Full marks to Van Wyk for presence of mind
AB pulls off a cracker of a catch! Munro bags a golden duck. Wiese is pumped. Munro nips down the track first ball, Wiese dug it shorter. Dragged towards mid-on. AB flies to his left and snaps it up
good length and on middle and leg, defended
down the track and outside-edges an attempted big hit. Skewed away to the right of the keeper
darted flat and outside leg, misses the sweep
tossed up and outside off, chipped over the covers. Miller runs in from long-off but it does not carry. He gets it on the half-volley
Morne drops it.. He finger-tips it away to the long-leg boundary. Phangiso is disappointed. Shortish and going down leg, helped over towards long leg with a pull. Morne messes it up
fires a full toss at 98.5ks, off the pad and sneaks away towards midwicket
flighted on middle, chipped in front of Behardien at long-off
darted down leg, swept away to the right of short fine leg for four
Elliott holes out to long-on. He skips down the track, Wiese brings out the change-up ball. Slower, short ball, which is spliced to Rossouw
short and outside off, slashed to backward point
pitched up and on the stumps, driven to mid-off
short and below chest-height, controlled pull to long leg
slower bouncer outside off at 116.9ks, beats the batsman and beats the keeper as well
banged in short and outside off, he goes for a pull. Hit high on the bat as Ronchi nearly spoons it to mid-on
drifts in on off, punched back at the bowler
flatter and turning away, cut to sweeper cover

a big appeal for lbw, the forefinger goes up and Phangiso roars. NZ losing their way after a speedy start. Darted flat on middle, Worker loads up for a massive slog-sweep and misses as he is trapped on the back foot, plumb in front of middle It would have hit the middle of middle.
swept from middle to long leg
spinning away, slow and wide outside off. Swipe and a miss
flat and outside off, punched off the back foot to long-off
back of a length and cuts back in, tucks the batsman up for room. Off the thigh pad and rolls to the right of keeper
back of a length, chopped behind, this time to the left of Van Wyk
shortish and on middle, Ronchi makes room but is surprised by extra bounce as he chops and finds backward point

Wiese spills it. Pops in and pops out while he is on the run. Latham goes for a pull and top-edges it, Wiese runs across to his right from third man and drops it. The keeper was also scampering back but he couldn't get there in time
back of a length and on the stumps, swiped away wide of mid-on. Cross-bat strike
yorker on middle, jammed to backward point
short ball on middle, half-hearted pull over square leg

a direct hit and the TV umpire is called in. Pretty full and outside off, not an accurate yorker. Squeezed to backward point as Ronchi sets off for a quick single. Wiese makes amends for the drop and nails a direct hit at the non-strikers' end.. A brief hesitation in the middle helped Wiese's cause.
good length and outside off, punchily driven to the covers
full and on off, driven straight to short cover
leans back and dabs a single from a fourth-stump line to third man
yorker just a shade outside off, under-edges it behind to the keeper
length and outside off, swung away to backward point
pitched further up and outside off, another big swing. This time, he does not connect
full and on middle and leg, clipped to midwicket, where Miller collects the ball but fails to throw the stumps down. A direct hit could have ended N Mac's stay..
full and on middle, drilled to the right of mid-on. AB dives to his right, rather calmly and stops the ball
bumpy, lifting short ball, beats the batsman on the hook
full and just a shade outside off, N Mac aims for a flashy drive and is beaten

Morkel clings onto it at long leg. Banged in short, Latham attempts a pull and top-edges it thickly. Morne tracks back, dives to his right and manages to catch it. Rabada's family is in the stands.. Rabada's father applauds
two in two for Rabada. He hits the blockhole on middle and leg, N Mac can't get under it as well as he would have wanted to. Swung into the hands of AB at mid-on
fuller and angled in, jabbing drive to long-on
bang! Bracewell nails it. He takes the short ball from outside off and pastes a pull over deep midwicket
slower, short ball outside off, chopped behind to the keeper
full and angled in, Mile wants to launch it over the leg side. He can't connect. They hare across for a run
